item.title: Join Velan Studios - An Introduction to Tech Art in the Games Industry! | April 1st, 2025
item.description: Join Velan Studios for an engaging session with their developers as they introduce the exciting world of Technical Art in the games industry. Learn how tech artists bridge the gap between art and engineering, bringing creative visions to life. Whether you’re an artist, programmer, or are simply passionate about games, this conversation will shed light on the role of Tech Art at Velan Studios. Register and learn more in Handshake!

item.title: An introduction to Human Spaceflight | March 25
item.description: Date: Tuesday, March 25, 2025 1:30 AM - 3:00 AM - Join us for “An introduction to human spaceflight” Rick Mastracchio ’87 MS ELEC NASA astronaut class of 1996. Veteran of three Space Shuttle missions STS-106, STS-118 and STS-131, a Russian Soyuz mission TMA-11M, two ISS Expeditions 38, 39 and nine spacewalks. He has logged >227 days in space. Rick is currently the senior director of business development for Northrop Grumman. The presentation will be followed by a extended Questions and Answer session.Where: CBIS Auditorium

item.title: ISATMA 2025 Spring Workshop: Reconnecting with Nature | March 26 (Registration Required)
item.description: Date: Wednesday, March 26, 2025 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM in the EMPAC Studio Beta - All are invited! The International Symposium on Assistive Technology for Music and Art started as a forum for researchers and artists dealing with the physical limitations of the human body and with embodiment in general. In spring 2025, the symposium expands its scope to workshop immersive technologies and holistic exercises for reducing stress and improving well-being in learning environments. Join us in March for a panel focused on breathing techniques and a demo of new AI developments.

item.title: Celebrating the Life of Chuck Boylen | March 29
item.description: Date: Saturday, March 29, 2025 11:00 AM - 2:30 PM - Dr. Charles “Chuck” Boylen died February 13 after a battle with pancreatic cancer. As Professor of Biology and Associate Director of RPI’s Darrin Fresh Water Institute (DFWI), he worked with all aspects of running the research field station. He was internationally known for his New York State limnology research, and was academic advisor to the Theta Xi fraternity. A celebration of life will be held on what would have been his 83rd birthday. All who knew him are welcome.Where: Chapel+Cultural Center, 2125 Burdett Avenue, Troy, NY 12180 New…

item.title: Do you know RPI’s Student Handbook?
item.description: Did you know that for RPI students, the Student Handbook and Graduate Student Supplement outline academic and disciplinary policies? For faculty and staff, these are detailed in the Human Resources Policy Guidelines and the Faculty Handbook. For more information, explore Standard 2 of RPI’s Self-Study for Middle States Accreditation: Ethics and Integrity, a team led by Dr. Dorit Nevo.

item.title: iEAR Presents! Dr. Theresa Jean Tanenbaum: Transformative Play Lab | March 26 (Virtual Event)
item.description: In this talk, Dr. Theresa Jean Tanenbaum theorizes an emancipatory design practice intended to restore agency and power to those of us who have suffered at the hands of the oppressive normative social order (which is to say, most of us). She illustrates this with a vulnerable autoethnographic discussion of her own experiences of gender transition, and with examples from larp, tabletop roleplaying games, and popular media. Join virtually on 3/26 at 7pm.

item.title: DotCIO - Information on Email sending limit exceeded – bulk emailing
item.description: For security reasons, a limitation of sending no more than 1000 emails/recipients per day and no more than 500 emails/recipients within an hour is in place for all students faculty and staff. This limit exists to stop bulk malicious email from accounts taken over by malware or scammers. Additionally, something to be aware of is that Microsoft has its own sending limit of 30 emails per minute. Please click in for more detail.

item.description:
